subject: Running
Track and Field
lead_paragraph: Usain Bolt of Jamaica won the 200 meters in 19.63 seconds, easing up before the finish, at the Athletissima Grand Prix in Lausanne, Switzerland. He had not run a 200 since the Olympics, where he won the gold medal with a world-record 19.30. This was the second-fastest time in the world this year. In the 100, Asafa Powell of Jamaica ran the second-fastest time ever, 9.72, which equals the time Bolt ran in New York in May; at the time, it was a world record. Bolt lowered it to 9.69 in winning gold in Beijing.
